file_content.text: The rebels have surrendered to our searches. The resistance is over.
If you would take on another task for us, I have a message from General Kolvin of the Imperial Reclamation Service.
He believes you might be key to recovering a secret the Empire has sought for decades. Thank you for all you've done.
I just received word from Admiral Jefand.
He says thanks to you, the Flame is dead and the rebellion is in chaos.
I assume I should have the rancor's share of any reward money?
What do I get for it?
Of course. It's being credited to your account right now.
He was just trying to avenge his people.
He was a good man.
If we mourned every conquered planet, we would never have become an Empire.
Thanks to me.
Your reputation doesn't lie.
He says that the Flame surrendered and went into voluntary exile?
If he learns to yield, the Flame does not need to be our enemy.
I gave him a second chance.
Admiral Jefand thinks I made a mistake.
The admiral wasn't pleased.
I will not defend my actions.
I wasn't there; I won't question you. There are certainly reasons one might have to hate the Empire.
Perhaps we all deserve a second chance.
I wouldn't keep the admiral waiting if I were you.
What exactly would you prefer I didn't know?
Admiral Jefand! Sir, I apologize. This is--
I know who they are. I would make a poor show of my rank if I failed to recognize so many heroes of the Empire in one place.
I know who you are, my lord. It is an honor to have one of your stature helping us on Nar Shaddaa.
I know who you are. You have made quite a reputation for yourself... in the right circles.
I know who you are. You've collected quite a fortune working for the Empire, have you not? All of it well-earned.
I know who you are. Your reputation has not gone unnoticed.
Are you more inclined than Agent Madel to tell me what threat has just been posed? Does this come from the Flame?
Any idea why he'd have it in for you personally?
He wants to kill you.
Does the answer come with a bonus?
What's it worth to you?
Does a group like this truly need to haggle for every credit?
I didn't realize Sith charged by the word.
This is part of your duty, agent.
I believe the payments you take are for blood, not words.
But you needn't answer. I know the Flame has been monitoring my communications with the Hutts.
Was it that obvious?
Learn from this, Madel. This was hardly a secret you could have kept.
The Flame must know I've been communicating with the Hutts.
I'm here to tell them the Empire will withdraw billions of credits of business from Nar Shaddaa unless they shut down this rebellion.
Killing you would be quite a coup for the Flame.
Which makes you a target.
We must teach him the folly of targeting the Empire.
Is that offer open to anyone?
Aren't the Hutts neutral?
Will they agree?
They're welcome to claim neutrality... as long as they don't interfere with our plans.
I invite you to come with me when I meet with the Hutts. Your activities have made an impression on the Cartel.
And it won't hurt your bargaining position to remind them of the power of the Sith.
I can do that.
It never does.
You do the talking, I'll keep an eye on what's happening behind the scenes?
Standard arrangement, then?
I see you've done this before.
Negotiation isn't exactly my specialty.
I'll give it a shot.
I believe your presence will be sufficient... incentive, for the Hutts.
What exactly do you expect from me?
Give me details.
Accompany me to the meeting, help the Hutts see the wisdom of cooperating.
I'm nobody's hanger-on.
I meant this as an arrangement between equals. The Hutts respect you.
If you're interested, I suggest you go first, to flush out and destroy any of these rebels who might lie in wait.
I leave for my meeting shortly. I hope to see you there.
Knowing Admiral Jefand, I'd suggest you go now. He'll expect the route to his meeting to be cleared before he leaves.
Your trap's been sprung. Here are the notes.
Let me see--
Blasted rebels! The Flame is planning an attack on Admiral Jefand Ange. He can't know about this. I was supposed to--
Be careful. They will be watching you as you get closer to the square.
Greetings. I heard of your success with the Shadow Syndicate. I was hoping you might put those talents to work for me.
Greetings, my lord. I heard of your arrival on Nar Shaddaa and was hoping you might make your way to this sector.
Greetings from HQ, my friend. They were hoping you could help me out with a little difficulty.
Ah. I had heard you'd come to Nar Shaddaa. Can I hope you're looking for work?
My name is Madel Felth, Imperial Intelligence, and I am here to stop a revolution.
I've been known to stop... or start... a few wars in my day.
You need help?
Give me the specs, I'll give you the price.
What's the job?
I've always thought Hutts were revolting....
Is that a joke?
The Hutts are not known for their senses of humor. But they are not our enemy.
This sector is home to alien refugees who escaped our slavers. They've never been a threat, but a new leader recently emerged.
You think I'd be interested?
They call this place the "Duros Sector," but it's not just Duros who live here. Alien refugees from across the galaxy have fled here. Fled from us.
Now a leader has emerged to unite the different species.
They call him "the Flame," and we have killed him twice. Each time, he reappears. The locals claim he's immortal.
Third time's the charm?
You want me to try again?
If the guy's got nine lives, you're paying for each one separate.
That'll be extra.
Is that possible?
Immortal?
Only the Emperor himself can claim true immortality. But I'm not asking you to kill the Flame--yet.
Our only undercover agent in his gang was recently discovered and murdered.
I think I'll pass.
Please. We had an agent undercover in the Flame's gang. They found him out and killed him, brutally.
The Flame insisted the corpse be publicly displayed in Rana Mas Square to taunt us.
If they're baiting you, they want something.
Sounds like a trap.
Oh, there's no doubt it's a trap. But they have bait we're hard-pressed to resist.
What do you care about the body?
Is there more to this?
You're right, of course. The body alone would not be sufficient bait for this trap.
If he's out in the open like that, it shouldn't be too difficult.
You want me to get it back?
No, it's a trap. And they've found a bait we can't resist.
Don't expect me to cry.
Our man knew the risks, but they're using more than just his death to bait their trap.
Everything our agent found, all his notes, are pinned to the corpse in plain view.
But every team I've sent to retrieve the records has come back in pieces. You may be the only one who could walk into this trap and survive.
Let these aliens do their worst, they have not faced a Sith before.
I will retrieve the records.
That was my thought precisely, my lord.
I'll give them pointers on the best pieces to send.
I would love to meet them.
Perhaps I was unclear, my lord. I don't doubt their skill at butchery.
This corpse has been there for days, right? What's so urgent now?
You sound nervous.
I should know better than to try to get anything by you.
Admiral Jefand Ange arrives today to discuss this problem with the Hutts. My job is on the line.
My jobs don't often require me to work so publicly.
Sounds like a good challenge.
You'll be making a statement. There is no trap they can set that we cannot break.
What's it worth to you?
Of course. We have a healthy budget; the Minister of Intelligence is quite concerned about this rebellion.
We need those records back. Admiral Jefand Ange is due to arrive today to speak with the Hutts about this problem.
Once you have the records, use this on the body to burn it. We can't have them use one of our own as a rallying point.
I don't make a habit of walking into traps.
You're a fool. [Refuse quest.]
Then we may never learn how far this Flame's conspiracy has spread.
If you'd like to contribute to the cause of refugee resettlement, please speak with the desk.
